Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Head of a king
Description: This sculptors model represents the head of a king, wearing a "nemes" head-dress of which the main part has been flattened: only the two lateral bands and the headband have been carved in stone. The eye contours are accentuated by a double line, elongated parallel to the eyebrows. The holes at the corners of the mouth accentuate an archaic smile.
